title: Install/reinstall driver
text: Install/reinstall driver 25 May 2022 15:08 If you can't handle it, the case is registered under Technique. Close the POS (shut it down completely with 999 and 70223010 Uninstall ELO Touchscreen Driver If you can't find it: Right-click on the taskbar and choose Task Manager Shut down all processes named elo ATTENTION!!! If you can't find any processes, shut down ELO under Services. Open Windows Explorer Find Program Files and delete enything called ELO Find Temp and delete folder TETouch (if it's there) Locate Windows/System32/Drivers Delete anything called elo Delete all monmouse files, if you can find any Delete all mmstub files, if you can find any Close Restart the PC Download the driver Find Elo Touch driver download for Windows on ELOs website https://www.elotouch.com/support/downloads#/ Or transfere it from your own pc, if you have it. This can somtimes be easier, if the client's PC is blocked from downloading anything from the net. Install the driver Set it tol Serial and USB Detect automatically (Detekter automatisk) Choose the Com port (can be anything from Com4 – Com9) Once the installation is done, restart the POS program and check if it helped. You may need to calibrate the screen to get it to function properly. See Touch screen is not working
description:
Install/reinstall driver

25 May 2022

15:08

 

If you can't handle it, the case is registered under Technique.

 

Close the POS (shut it down completely with 999 and 70223010

 

Uninstall ELO Touchscreen Driver

 

If you can't find it:

    1. Right-click on the taskbar and choose Task Manager

 

    1. Shut down all processes named elo

 

    1. ATTENTION!!! If you can't find any processes, shut down ELO under Services.

 

    1. Open Windows Explorer

 

    1. Find Program Files and delete enything called ELO

 

    1. Find Temp and delete folder TETouch (if it's there)

 

    1. Locate Windows/System32/Drivers

 

    1. Delete anything called elo

 

    1. Delete all monmouse files, if you can find any

 

    1. Delete all mmstub files, if you can find any

 

    1. Close

 

    1. Restart the PC

 

    1. Download the driver

 

Find Elo Touch driver download for Windows on ELOs website

 

https://www.elotouch.com/support/downloads#/

 

Or transfere it from your own pc, if you have it. This can somtimes be easier, if the client's PC is blocked from downloading anything from the net.

 

    1. Install the driver

 

    1. Set it tol Serial and USB

 

    1. Detect automatically (Detekter automatisk)

 

    1. Choose the Com port (can be anything from Com4 – Com9)

 

Once the installation is done, restart the POS program and check if it helped. You may need to calibrate the screen to get it to function properly. See Touch screen is not working

title: Touch screen is not working
text: Touch screen is not working 3. august 2022 16:00 If, for some reason, ELO Touch doesn't work, first try to restart the PC. If this does not work, then try to recalibrate the screen. You need the cusomter's help for this. Touch each target firmly. Then touch the green checkmark to finish the calibration. If you cannot finde ELO on the Task List, you can assume it is not running. Open Control Panel, Programmes & Features and check if the ELO driver is installed. If it is, open it, and run the calibration from there. If not, go to https://www.elotouch.com/support/downloads#/ and choose the appropriate driver for the Windows version. Install the driver, run the calibration and have the sales clerk try touching the targets again. If this still does not work, have the sales clerk shut down the PC, pull the power plug, and leave it without power for 10-30 seconds, then plug it in again and restart. Should this fail as well, then it is possible that the POS needs to be repalced.
description:
Touch screen is not working

3. august 2022

16:00

 

If, for some reason, ELO Touch doesn't work, first try to restart the PC.

 

If this does not work, then try to recalibrate the screen. You need the cusomter's help for this.

 

 

 

Touch each target firmly.

 

Then touch the green checkmark to finish the calibration.

 

If you cannot finde ELO on the Task List, you can assume it is not running.

 

Open Control Panel, Programmes & Features and check if the ELO driver is installed.

If it is, open it, and run the calibration from there. 

If not, go to https://www.elotouch.com/support/downloads#/ and choose the appropriate driver for the Windows version.

 

Install the driver, run the calibration and have the sales clerk try touching the targets again.

 

If this still does not work, have the sales clerk shut down the PC, pull the power plug, and leave it without power for 10-30 seconds, then plug it in again and restart.

 

Should this fail as well, then it is possible that the POS needs to be repalced.
